pull.title: qt: add missing cs_wallet locks
pull.body: The duplicate check in AddressTableModel::setData accesses wallet data structure without proper LOCK, fix this.

repo.name: bitcoin
repo.description: Laanwj's Bitcoin Core fork - see README.md on "readme" branch

events.body:
Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/3e321180e2d559da67f23afae62beeee401d5ef2 for binaries and test log.
This test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/current/
Contact BlueMatt on freenode if something looks broken.

issue.title: Document cs_wallet lock and add AssertLockHeld

events.message:
qt: add missing cs_wallet lock in AddressTableModel::setData

duplicate check in AddressTableModel::setData accesses
wallet data structure as well as SetAddressBook without proper LOCK, fix this.

qt: Add missing LOCKs for locked coin functions

These don't aquire the wallet lock internally, so the caller has to do
it.
qt: protect SetAddressBook with cs_wallet lock everywhere

qt: Add missing lock in WalletModel::listCoins

Another problem detected by cs_wallet lock detection (#3401).

comments.body: So, how would you propose doing it? I didn't want to double-indent the entire block either.
@sipa I've refactored the function a bit do prevent the strange style anywhere and make it easier to read
I find such else if's rather hard to read, when they are behind a `}`.

Let's just agree that this is better than the original?
The point of this pull is to fix some serious locking issues, not to change the code into a work of art.

Sure and agreed, but I'm allowed to give such feedback anyway :)?
I consider myself of no help in code parts with locking and such, sorry...
